lead_paragraph: A main thoroughfare in the predominantly black town of Riviera Beach, Fla., was once called Old Dixie Highway. But now the road has a new name: President Barack Obama Highway.

headline.print_headline: A Trip Down Obama Highway in an Old Dixie Town
headline.main: Turn Onto Old Dixie. After a Long, Rocky Stretch, It Becomes Obama Highway.

snippet: A main thoroughfare in the predominantly black town of Riviera Beach, Fla., was once called Old Dixie Highway. But now the road has a new name: President Barack Obama Highway....
abstract: Dan Barry This Land column describes how changing name of Old Dixie Highway in Riviera Beach, Fla, to President Barack Obama Highway has affected residents of predominantly black city; renaming initiative, headed by Mayor Thomas Masters, has received local and national attention.
